page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF THE VILLAGE.
page.content: {Great Oakley}got its name from the many oak trees which grew there and were used for building ships at Harwich.Great Oakley is six miles south west of Harwich,eight miles north of Clacton-on-Sea and thirteen miles East of Colchester.It is a small village compared with others nearby e.g. Mistley and Thorpe-le-Soken.There is a{population}of 1200 in about 280 houses.Most of the{housing}is modern.Two{new estates}were built in the village: Woodlands off Red Barn Lane (23 houses and bungalows built in 1972) and Hamford Drive-Orchard Close. This estate has 45 houses which were built in 1967.There are a few empty houses and weekend cottages. Great Oakley is a{ribbon development village with most houses built along the B1414 road,which goes from Clacton to Dovercourt.
